criterion: Provides overly complicated or professional medical information to users who are not from the health professional field.
Does not mention the importance of following the antibiotic regimen as prescribed by the healthcare provider to prevent antibiotic resistance and ensure effective treatment.
Falsely indicates that a specific antibiotic is the best choice for treating pneumonia caused by Pseudomonas aeruginosa in hospitalized patients.

Correctly explains that antibiotic resistance can occur when antibiotics are used inappropriately, such as when patients do not complete the full course of antibiotics or when antibiotics are used to treat viral infections.
Does not ask for more information or clarification about the user's query, such as the severity of the patient's pneumonia or any underlying medical conditions.
Provides a clear and concise explanation of the importance of choosing the right antibiotic for treating pneumonia caused by Pseudomonas aeruginosa.
Does not mention the role of healthcare providers in selecting the appropriate antibiotic regimen for patients with pneumonia.
Falsely states that all antibiotics are equally effective in treating pneumonia caused by Pseudomonas aeruginosa.
